intro: Cranichis perezii, commonly known as the Peruvian orchid, is a species of orchid native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and delicate, fragrant flowers. The plant typically produces small, greenish-yellow blooms with intricate patterns, often resembling those of other orchid genera. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
